channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: An XML representation of a search request

item.title: [HIVE-3836] Add Hive SQL support for Twitter Storm
item.description: I see there has the Squall that processing the SQL on top of Twitter Storm with time window, join, group by and other functions support. I really think it is a good idea that Hive can have handler to handle Storm thing. Any thoughts?
item.summary: Add Hive SQL support for Twitter Storm

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-3837] Three Table BucketMapJoin is failing
item.description:
The following three table bucketmapjoin query returns 0 as result:

set hive.optimize.bucketmapjoin = true;
set hive.input.format = org.apache.hadoop.hive.ql.io.BucketizedHiveInputFormat;

CREATE TABLE t1 (key1 int, value1 string) partitioned by (ds1 string) CLUSTERED BY (key1) INTO 2 BUCKETS STORED AS TEXTFILE;
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE t1 partition(ds1='part1');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE t1 partition(ds1='part1');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE t1 partition(ds1='part2');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE t1 partition(ds1='part2');

CREATE TABLE t2 (key2 int, value2 string) partitioned by (ds2 string) CLUSTERED BY (key2) INTO 2 BUCKETS STORED AS TEXTFILE;
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE t2 partition(ds2='part1');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE t2 partition(ds2='part1');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE t2 partition(ds2='part2');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE t2 partition(ds2='part2');

CREATE TABLE t3 (key3 int, value3 string) partitioned by (ds3 string) CLUSTERED BY (key3) INTO 2 BUCKETS STORED AS TEXTFILE;
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket20.txt' INTO TABLE t3 partition(ds3='part1');
load data local inpath '../data/files/srcbucket21.txt' INTO TABLE t3 partition(ds3='part1');

– Three Tables Join
explain extended
select /+mapjoin(b,c)/ count
from t1 a join t2 b on (a.key1=b.key2 and a.ds1=b.ds2) join t3 c on (a.key1=c.key3 and a.ds1=c.ds3);

select /+mapjoin(b,c)/ count
from t1 a join t2 b on (a.key1=b.key2 and a.ds1=b.ds2) join t3 c on (a.key1=c.key3 and a.ds1=c.ds3);

It should return 1114(if we run a join without mapjoin).

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-3839] adding .gitattributes file for normalizing line endings during cross platform development
item.description:
On the lines of HADOOP-8912 .
Many developers clone the apache/hive git repository to make changes.
Adding a .gitattributes file will help in doing the right thing while checking out files on Windows (eg- adding on checkout of most text files, preserving in case of *.sh files ), and replacing with while checking in code back into a git repository.
item.summary: adding .gitattributes file for normalizing line endings during cross platform development

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Committed to trunk. Thanks, Thejas!

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #1885 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/1885/)
HIVE-3839 : adding .gitattributes file for normalizing line endings during cross platform development (Thejas Nair via Ashutosh Chauhan) (Revision 1426691)

Result = SUCCESS
hashutosh : http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi/?root=Apache-SVN&view=rev&rev=1426691
Files :

  • /hive/trunk/.gitattributes

Ashutosh Chauhan and Thejas M Nair this caused me some grief on Mac OS X when cloning the hive git repo on Mac OS X. I believe it's due to some files in the hive repo that already contain CRLF that weren't normalized. I created HIVE-3858 and submitted a patch there. It's a fairly cosmetic change. Can you please take a look and comment?

Integrated in Hive-trunk-hadoop2 #54 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-hadoop2/54/)

Result = ABORTED

item.title: [HIVE-3840] hive cli null representation in output is inconsistent
item.summary: hive cli null representation in output is inconsistent

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Currently, hive cli behavior is following:

  • It prints null valued primitive types (except binary) as NULL
  • Null binary column is printed as null
  • All null complex types are printed as null
  • All null primitive types within non-null complex types are printed as null

This hive cli behavior is inconsistent with itself. MySQL prints NULL for all column type and we should do the same in all cases.
HIVE-3840.1.patch - Patch for making the null representation consistent. Uses 'NULL' for all datatypes.
review board link - https://reviews.apache.org/r/10312/
Comments on RB.
Comments response on RB.
+1 will commit if tests pass.
Committed to trunk. Thanks, Thejas!

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #2049 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2049/)

item.title: [HIVE-3841] Sampling in previous MR for range partitioning of next RS
item.description:
Currently hive enforces single reducer for order by clause, which can be performance bottleneck.

If sampling could be done on ordering key at previous MR stage, multiple reducers could be assigned for it.
item.summary: Sampling in previous MR for range partitioning of next RS

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
navis requested code review of "HIVE-3841 [jira] Sampling in previous MR for range partitioning of next RS".
Reviewers: JIRA

DPAL-1945 Sampling in previous MR for range partitioning of next RS

Currently hive enforces single reducer for order by clause, which can be performance bottleneck.

If sampling could be done on ordering key at previous MR stage, multiple reducers could be assigned for it.

item.title: [HIVE-3844] Unix timestamps don't seem to be read correctly from HDFS as Timestamp column
item.description:
Serega Shepak pointed out that something like

select cast(date_occurrence as timestamp) from xvlr_data limit 10

where date_occurrence has BIGINT type (timestamp in milliseconds) works. But it doesn't work if the declared type is TIMESTAMP on column. The data in the date_occurence column in unix timestamp in millis.
item.summary: Unix timestamps don't seem to be read correctly from HDFS as Timestamp column

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Dupe of HIVE-3454 ?

Thanks Ashutosh. HIVE-3454 deals with specifying milliseconds for casting numerical unix timestamps to Timestamp type which it makes HIVE-3822 a duplicate of it. I will mark it as so. However, this issue still prevails whereby a file containing unix timestamps (regardless of whether they are in seconds or milliseconds) on HDFS can't be interpreted as a timestamp column in a Hive table. The workaround is to read it as a bigint and use cast ( my_col as timestamp) in the queries.
{~mgrover} I am wondering whether you are working on this issue. If not, I would be happy to work on this issue.

Venki,
I am not. Assigned it to you.
Hi Mark Grover, Here is the initial patch https://reviews.apache.org/r/15105/. It covers the three formats mentioned here . Please review it and provide feedback.

Venki,
Thanks for working on this!
I have added a comment to reviewboard. Catching an exception and converting it will be extremely slow.
It would be better to check the format and do the conversion appropriately. Also, BigDecimal is something that is considered to be slow.

cc'ing Jason Dere who is a data type expert!

For now, I have updated the doc to say what text format is supported - https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/pages/diffpagesbyversion.action?pageId=27838462&selectedPageVersions=27&selectedPageVersions=26

Should we really be allowing numeric formats to be read as timestamp? If the data is in integer/floating point format, I'd think we should be treating those columns as integer/floating point and apply the appropriate cast or UDF to convert it to a timestamp type. In any case, I added a comment to the RB.

Updated the patch to use Pattern/Matcher to identify the format of timestamp. I thought about not using the BigDecimal, but the output has floating point errors.

Reg: Should we really be allowing numeric formats to be read as timestamp?
I have seen multiple customers that have logs with different timestamp formats and they want to create one table with timestamp schema and read all sources of data.

item.title: [HIVE-3845] Fix bugs in package.jdo
item.description: There are few bugs lurking in package.jdo which gets exposed only when DN version is bumped up. Though these bugs surface only with newer DN versions they are are not related to DN version but rather incorrect mappings we have defined in our package.jdo These should be fixed regardless of whether we bump up DN version or not. These are defined accurately at https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2084?focusedCommentId=13014240&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13014240

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment: Also at: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2609?focusedCommentId=13228911&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13228911

item.title: [HIVE-3846] alter view rename NPEs with authorization on.
item.summary: alter view rename NPEs with authorization on.

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
hive> set hive.security.authorization.enabled=true;
hive> CREATE TABLE tbl_j5jbymsx8e (key INT, value STRING) PARTITIONED BY (ds STRING);
hive> CREATE VIEW view_j5jbymsx8e_1 as SELECT * FROM tbl_j5jbymsx8e;
hive> DESCRIBE view_j5jbymsx8e_1;
hive> ALTER VIEW view_j5jbymsx8e_1 RENAME TO view_j5jbymsx8e_2;
FAILED: NullPointerException null

HiveOperation.ALTERVIEW_RENAME was missing.

I added it on HiveOperation and SemanticAnalyzerFactory. Also I added a test to reproduce the error as Ashutosh Chauhan mentioned and it was fixed.
Review request on https://reviews.apache.org/r/10771/

Few comments:

  • I think you forgot to add .q.out file in your patch.
  • In the .q testcase, can you add set hive.security.authorization.enabled=false; at the end. Otherwise, authorization will be on for rest of the tests as well.
  • Test TestCliDriver.alter_view_rename.q and TestNegativeCliDriver.recursive_view.q fails after patch. There .q.out file needs to be updated.
I see, Ashutosh Chauhan. I'll update the patch. Thank you for your comments.

Summary of changes

  • authorization_8.q.out is included.
  • authorization_8.q does not make other tests fail. <code>REVOKE ALL FROM USER hive_test_user; set hive.security.authorization.enabled=false;</code> is appended.
  • alter_view_rename.q.out and recursive_view.q.out is updated.
Committed to trunk. Thanks, Teddy!

Integrated in Hive-trunk-h0.21 #2126 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Hive-trunk-h0.21/2126/)

comments.comment: Reported by Ankit Kamboj on https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HIVE-2791?focusedCommentId=13506756&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-13506756 and I verified bug still exists on trunk. Workaround of disabling the optimization gets the correct behavior as well.

Ashutosh,
I've verified the query is working when both HIVE-3699 and HIVE-3849 are applied.
Two sub-issues related to it are checked in.

item.title: [HIVE-3848] branch-0.10 fails to compile on OpenJDK7

trunk compiles with openJDK7 fine. HIVE-3384 needs to be merged into 0.10

item.summary: branch-0.10 fails to compile on OpenJDK7

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

item.title: [HIVE-3849] Aliased column in where clause for multi-groupby single reducer cannot be resolved
item.description:
Verifying HIVE-3847, I've found an exception is thrown before meeting the error situation described in it. Something like,

FAILED: SemanticException [Error 10025]: Line 40:6 Expression not in GROUP BY key 'crit5'
item.summary: Aliased column in where clause for multi-groupby single reducer cannot be resolved

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.
